SEARCH
Package net.issachanzi.resteasy.model

Class EasyModel

java.lang.Object
net.issachanzi.resteasy.model.EasyModel
public abstract class EasyModel extends Object
Base class for a model in a Rest Easy application

Rest Easy scans the classpath for all subclasses of EasyModel and exposes all models via a REST API.

A database table will be automatically created for each EasyModel subclass. All public fields will be automatically persisted when the save(Connection) method is called, if they are of supported type. This can be overridden with the NoPersist annotation.

All public fields will be automatically be exposed for read and write access via a REST API by default. This can be overridden with the NoHttp annotation.

Authorisation checks can be done by overriding the authorize(String, AccessType) method.

  • Field Details

    • id

      public UUID id
      An ID field as a primary key for the database table.

      It's usual for a model to have a unique ID, so it shouldn't have to be manually coded.

    • byId

      public static <M extends EasyModel> M byId(Connection db, UUID id, Class<M> clazz, EasyModel chainSource) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a model instance from the database based on its id

      This version of the method exists to break recursion loops caused by fetching associations. If the id parameter matches the id of the model instance specified by chainSource, then this method will simply return the value chainSource without querying the database or fetching any data.

      Type Parameters:
      M - The class of the model instance to find
      Parameters:
      db - Databbase connection to use
      id - The id of the model instance to find
      clazz - The class of the model instance to find
      chainSource - Model instance to break recursion on
      Returns:
      The model instance with the specified id
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database query fails

    • where

      public static <M extends EasyModel> Collection<M> where(Connection db, Map<String,String> strFilter, Class<M> clazz) throws SQLException
      Retrieves from the database instances of a specified model that matches specified filter conditions

      Models will be returned if, for each specified filter key, the corresponding model attribute matches the value given,

      Type Parameters:
      M - The model class to return instances of
      Parameters:
      db - The database connection to use
      strFilter - The map of filter conditions to apply
      clazz - The model class to return instances of
      Returns:
      A collection of model instances matching the filter criteria
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database query fails

    • where

      public static <M extends EasyModel> Collection<M> where(Connection db, String whereSql, Object[] params, Class<M> clazz) throws SQLException
      Retrieves from the database instances of a specified model that match an arbitrary SQL WHERE clauss

      Never interpolate user input or untrusted data of any kind into SQL queries (such as the whereSql param). Always use parameterised queries, which should be hard coded wherever possible.

      What is SQL injection - Cloudflare

      Type Parameters:
      M - The model class to return instances of
      Parameters:
      db - The database connection to use
      whereSql - The SQL WHERE clause. ? characters can be used for parameter placeholders. This parameter must never contain untrusted data such as user input.
      clazz - The model class to return instances of
      Returns:
      A collection of model instances matching the filter criteria
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database query fails

    • authorize

      public boolean authorize(String authorization, AccessType accessType)
      Checks whether an attempt to access this model instance is allowed

      This method should be overridden by subclasses of EasyModel, if authorisation is desired.

      The default implementation always returns true, allowing any user to create, read, update and delete EasyModel instances without authentication.

      Parameters:
      authorization - The value of the Authorization HTTP header
      accessType - The type of operation requested. Either CREATE, READ UPDATE or DELETE.
      Returns:
      true if the access is allowed. false if it is denied.
